intro: Phanerophlebiopsis neopodophylla, commonly known as the New Podophyllum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Podostemaceae and is characterized by its unique aquatic adaptations. The plant typically grows in slow-moving freshwater habitats, such as along riverbanks and in swampy areas. Its leaves are submerged, while its flowers emerge above the water surface. It plays an important ecological role in supporting aquatic biodiversity.
